CatDescriptText: Don Stewart, postal worker, 804 Clarissa Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 7, 1959, pg. 29 with question: "Do you think that the Wacs and others women's units, with the exception of nurses, should be abolished in armed services during peacetime? Why?" answer reads: "From the people I know, it seems as though they have control of their families.  I've just been in the neighborhood a short time and only know a few families."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Don Stewart wearing light colored ribbed overcoat, moustache, striped button down collared shirt, and watch, standing on sidewalk in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
